physical_appearance: This is a white kebaya top. It has a intricate grid-like pattern embroided across the fabric. The edges of the top is decorated with lace.
sgcool_label_text: This white kebaya has an intricate grid-like pattern embroidered across its surface. Modest amount of lace decorates the edges. Paired with a sarong, kebayas would have been worn by European and Eurasian women before it was adopted by Peranakan women sometime around the turn of the 20th century. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of garments worn by Peranakan men and women.
subject_terms_1: folk costume Peranakan cultural diffusion tops (garments, general) blouses (main garments)
subject_terms_2: Ethnic costume Peranakan (Asian people) Culture diffusion Blouses
